member.summary: Used to discriminate in more detail between the priorities of items in a project. It is used by to determine the best project to open a file. If you want your projects to express this detailed priority value, you should implement in addition to implementing .

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7
member.summary: Specifies properties of the Visual Studio shell.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_CanBuildQuickCheck
member.summary: VT_I4 [optional] Returns a that determines whether the given project can perform building via . This property can be used as a quick test to know if build-related features should be enabled.The absence of this property is equivalent to returning : the caller must call to see if building is possible. : feature is always enabled; : feature is enabled now; : feature is not enabled now; : feature is not implemented. Returning QCA_Never/No does not stop all callers from accessing and using the project's interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_CanDebugLaunchQuickCheck
member.summary: VT_I4 [optional] Returns a regarding if the given project can perform F5 debug launch via .The absence of this property is equivalent to returning : the caller must call to see if building is possible. : feature is always enabled; : feature is enabled now; : feature is not enabled now; : feature is not implemented. Returning QCA_Never/No does not stop all callers from accessing and using the project's interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_CanDeployQuickCheck
member.summary: T_I4 [optional] Returns a that determines whether the given project can perform deploying via .The absence of this property is equivalent to returning : the caller must call to see if building is possible. : feature is always enabled; : feature is enabled now; : feature is not enabled now; : feature is not implemented. Returning QCA_Never/No does not stop all callers from accessing and using the project's interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_DeploymentRelativePath
member.summary: VT_BSTR [optional] Gets the deployment relative path of the given item. The deployment relative path is the file location relative to the package directory, when the given file is deployed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_ExcludeFromMoveFileToProjectUI
member.summary: VT_BOOL [optional] Returns true if the given project wants to be excluded from participating with cmdidMoveFileToProjectXXX commands.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_IsSharedFolder
member.summary: VT_BOOL [optional] Returns true if the given item represents the folder node as an ancestor of shared items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_IsSharedItem
member.summary: VT_BOOL [optional] If this returns true, this item is imported from another project file that is shared across projects. Otherwise it returns false. A shared item is special. It is added to this importing project hierarchy as a hidden linked file, so it is enumerable via and , but it cannot be mutated by this importing project.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_IsSharedItemsImportFile
member.summary: VT_BOOL [optional] Returns true if the given item represents the MSBuild file that imports the shared items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_MSBuildImportsStorage
member.summary: VT_UNKNOWN [optional] Returns the implementation of IVsMSBuildImportsStorage for a project.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_OneAppCapabilities
member.summary: VT_BSTR [optional] Returns the "one app" capabilities. When they include "Migration" or "Add Platform", they are used to pick the right template using ApplyTo metadata from templates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_ProjectTreeCapabilities
member.summary: VT_BSTR [optional] Provides a space-delimited list of project tree node capabilities. Note: Unlike VSHPROPID_ProjectCapabilities, which is available only on the Project Root node, this property is allowed on every node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_SharedAssetsProject
member.summary: VT_UNKNOWN [optional] Returns the implementation of IVsSharedAssetsProject for the given shared project hierarchy. The item ID should be VSITEMID_ROOT.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_SharedItemContextHierarchy
member.summary: VT_UNKNOWN [optional] Gets or sets the contextual IVsHierarchy for the items that are shared by other projects. It is used for sharing scenarios, for example, when a document is shared across projects. When someone edits that document, one project must be selected as the context to offer to IntelliSense. The currently-selected project hierarchy could be retrieved or changed via this property on the master owning project hierarchy. Note this property is per-project in the current implementation, GetProperty/SetProperty must be invoked on the root node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_SharedItemsImportFullPaths
member.summary: VT_BSTR [optional] Provides a vertical bar ('|') delimited list of the full paths of the "Shared.items" project files that have been imported by the project. Note: This property does not return "Shared.items" files for Shared Folder nodes that manage their shared MSBuild file as a nested hierarchy implementation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_SharedProjectHierarchy
member.summary: VT_UNKNOWN [optional] Returns the actual owning shared project hierarchy of the given shared item. Note: The item ID should be the ID of a shared item. If the given item is already an item in a shared assets project, then it returns this shared assets project.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID7.VSHPROPID_ShortSubcaption
member.summary: VT_BSTR [optional] The short version of VSHPROPID_Subcaption.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IAppxManifestDesignerService3
member.summary: Provides programmatic access to a project's .appxmanifext file. You can use it to open a DocData object provided by the Manifest Designer, ensure that it is registered in the running document table (RDT), and return a document handle object that implements two interfaces: IVsDocumentLockHolder and IVsInvisibleEditor. This forces any existing document window to close, and causes the returned document handle to hold a RDT_EditLock. When you need to keep the document handle for longer periods of time, cast it to IVsInvisibleEditor and use GetDocData to get a pointer to a fresh object model. When finished with the document handle, always call IVsDocumentLockHolder.CloseDocumentHolder(), usually passing (uint)__FRAMECLOSE.FRAMECLOSE_SaveIfDirty as the save option.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IAppxManifestDesignerService3.OpenAppxManifestDesigner(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsDocumentLockHolder,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.AppxManifestDesignerTab)
member.summary: Opens the .appxmanifest designer displaying the specified tab with the given document handle.
member.param: The document handle
The tab to display.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IAppxManifestDesignerService3.OpenAppxManifestDesigner(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsDocumentLockHolder,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.AppxManifestDesignerTab2)
member.summary: Opens the .appxmanifest designer.
member.param: The document handle.
The tab to display.

member.summary: Initiates deployment of the app container application on the local machine. It creates a "layout folder" containing the app files as defined in the package recipe file and registers the application with Windows package manager. After successfully executing of this process, the application is ready to be launched on the local box or on the simulator.
member.returns: The app container application deployed on the local machine.
member.param: [in] The deployment options for this instance of the app container application.
[in] The package recipe file that defines the package contents.
[in] The location where the app container application is deployed.
[in] The unique name of the project.
[in] The callback routine that is to be notified when events occur.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsProjectFileReloadManagerEvents
member.summary: Implemented by clients that coordinate files required for loading projects.You subscribe to these events via IVsSolution::AdviseSolutionEvents.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsProjectFileReloadManagerEvents.OnQueryAdditionalFilesToBeClosedBeforeProjectsReloaded(System.Int32,System.Guid[])
member.summary: Occurs before unloaded projects are reloaded by the user. The implementer of this event sink is expected to return the list of additional files that need to be closed before the projects can be reloaded. The unloaded projects' project files are already known to be closed and need not be included in the list that is returned by this method. The implementer does not need to look the files up in the Running Document Table to see if they are actually open. Visual Studio makes sure that the files are actually open in an editor (i.e. not registered in the RDT with the RDT_ProjSlnDocument flag set). These additional files are typically files imported or included by the unloaded project files that must be available in order for the reloading projects to open.
member.returns: An array of the names of files to be closed.
member.param: The number of projects to be reloaded.
An array of ProjectID GUIDs of unloaded projects to be reloaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolution6.SetProjectParent(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy)
member.summary: Sets the parent of the project. The solution considers to be a child (in a nested hierarchy) of , and it does not enumerate it in the solution hierarchy. The hierarchy is responsible for adding a visual representation of this project in Solution Explorer. is expected to implement IVsParentProject3, otherwise this method does nothing.
member.param: The IVsHierarchy element of the project.
The IVsHierarchy element of the project's parent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionEvents6
member.summary: Provides events associated with solutions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionEvents6.OnAfterProjectRegisteredInRunningDocumentTable(System.Guid,System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The notification that is fired during project creation, after the solution has registered the project file in the RunningDocumentTable. This event can be used to find out the value that was assigned to the project in the RDT. Note: If the solution's call to RegisterAndLockDocument failed, then will be VSCOOKIE_NIL. Clients of this event are expected to explicitly recognize this case and react accordingly. For example, a client may want to re-register their project placeholder document in the RDT.
member.param: The project ID.
The full path of the project file.
The doc cookie in the RunningDocumentTable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSolutionEvents6.OnBeforeProjectRegisteredInRunningDocumentTable(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: A notification fired during project creation, before the solution attempts to register the project file in the RunningDocumentTable. This event can be used to find out when to unregister a project placeholder document from the RDT so as to not block the opening of the real project.
member.param: The project ID.
The full path of the project file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.SharedMSBuildFilesManagerHierarchy
member.summary: A project hierarchy with shared MSBuild files. In the Save Changes dialog, this project file appears with the name "[Shared MSBuild Project Files]". This node appears in the Save Changes dialog when there are shared MSBuild files that need to be saved and the files do not have affinity to a particular shared assets project. A new singleton instance of this hierarchy is created (if necessary) for each solution and closed when the solution closes. This singleton hierarchy always has the same value as its property. The SharedMSBuildFilesManagerHierarchy project supports the and properties for each of its shared MSBuild file project items.
